title: What do you think is the most pointless passive in the game?
body:
Keep in mind that I'm not talking about passives that are underpowered, or even passives that don't fit the rest of the champions kit.
I'm talking about passives that just seem... uninspired.

Like Shyvanas armor buff.
Why not just give her more base armor?

literally doesn't have a passive, it's just a tooltip explaining how his resource works lol.

I think {{champion:36}}'s passive is a fail. It is just a useless version of {{champion:86}}'s passive. {{item:3083}} alone is over 3x better while in combat, and a whopping 10x better when out of combat.
Wrong, Mundo's passive is 0.3% of his max hp *each second*. It actually gives him 1.5% of his max health per 5, which is 50% stronger than Warmogs in combat.
Well color me surprised. Your right.

Actually, Shyvana's passive is there to augment her dragon form so that she can tank while in it much easier than other champions could and still build some spare damage. It isn't the most inspired thing, but it does serve a purpose.

Honestly, the passive for me that's the most uninspired for the game is probably Zilean's. It makes no sense at all. He's a time bending mage, so all of a sudden his teammates are... learning more? Why? If you want to say that it's because they're "growing" at an accelerated rate, why aren't their other over time stats also increased? If Zilean's passive is making time pass more quickly for his teammates, shouldn't they also have more health/mana regen, or lower cooldowns? Higher movement speed? Time is passing quicker for them than those around them, right?

Surprised no one has mentioned {{champion:12}} yet. Not only is it pathetically underwhelming, it's pretty uninteresting as well. You basically forget it's there until you start accidentally stealing cs as support alistar. Unless you're playing jungle/top lane alistar that is, but that's not allowed. The only cs you're getting is the cs you accidentally steal, buddy!
It was originally designed to let him jungle, but now they don't want him to jungle and it's just kinda weak.

AP Bruiser Alistar is when his passive becomes monstrous. RoA>Rylai's>Liandry's turns you into an unstoppable super tanky AOE Burning ball of death. His passive proc rylai's and liandry's, and the AP from those three items makes the base hurt a lot too (around 60-70 base damage based on runes, and then burning for 4% current HP per second on top of that). 

It is very underwhelming as a support, but the double damage to minions + a sunfire cape make you push like a god, and helps you transition into a late game split push tank.

Passives that regain mana or grant free spells are generally weak, but Swain's is particularly bad and Veigar's takes the cake. Don't forget Xerath. His passive gives him a crap ton of mana if you let him auto attack you. Which you shouldn't, but still, ja feel
To be fair, the more recent addition of an {{item:3174}}-effect to {{champion:50}}s passive is pretty intuitive given his Ult.

The recent addition helped it a lot, but I still kinda feel like they could have just increased base mana regen and achieved the same effect. I wouldn't want them to disrupt his balance, though, because his kit feels complete and fair right now. I'm quite happy with it, even if I think it's a bit... "uninspired," was the word the OP used.
I think the "on champion kill"-part is at least marginally better, given that you have to participate or take action to acquire it. It allows you to participate longer when you are successful.
